title: BACKYARD / SMOKER ON THE BALCONY
description: The balcony overlooks the scene of the hanging but he's not a witness. He told as much to the investigator before, who you can ascertain was from Whitewater: foreshadowing for the HONOUR COURT's arrival later. EDITED VERSION

dialogueTree.title: Smoker on the Balcony: "You see a young man on a balcony nu..."
dialogueTree.text: You see a young man on a balcony nursing a cigarette. His eyes have been following you for a while.

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""Not looking for any trouble, offic..."
links.text: "Not looking for any trouble, officer..." he says in a quiet voice. Despite the cold, his shirt hangs unbuttoned on his frame.

links.title: Drama: "It's the voice of someone who has s..."
links.text: It's the voice of someone who has something to *hide* my liege.

links.title: You: ""You hiding something? Speak up, th..."
links.text: "You hiding something? Speak up, this is the police."

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""There's no trouble, I'm just speak..."
links.text: "There's no trouble, I'm just speaking in a *lowered voice*," he says sotto voce.

links.title: You: ""Why are you whispering? It sounds..."
links.text: "Why are you whispering? It sounds like you're *already* in trouble."

links.title: You: ""No trouble from me, I just want to..."
links.text: "No trouble from me, I just want to know what's going on here."

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""I don't want to be seen talking to..."
links.text: "I don't want to be seen talking to the *gendarmerie*, if that's okay. I just want to finish my cigarette."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "It's the God of Cigarettes and Yout..."
links.text: It's the God of Cigarettes and Youth -- ask him if he's got anything to spare.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Don't let him go! This could be you..."
links.text: Don't let him go! This could be your witness -- the balcony has a great view of the whole thing.

links.title: You: ""Hold on... Can I at least have a c..."
links.text: "Hold on... Can I at least have a cigarette?"

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""Apologies, but this is my last one..."
links.text: "Apologies, but this is my last one." He takes another drag and shivers.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "The God Himself has denied you abso..."
links.text: The God Himself has denied you absolution.

links.title: You: ""I need absolution!""
links.text: "I need absolution!"

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""Absolution? I don't know that bran..."
links.text: "Absolution? I don't know that brand, but I'm pretty sure you can get Astras at the Frittte."

links.title: You: ""Can't you just like, toss that one..."
links.text: "Can't you just like, toss that one down?"

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""I'm not sure that's a good idea.""
links.text: "I'm not sure that's a good idea."

links.title: You: ""Shut up and throw, kid!""
links.text: "Shut up and throw, kid!"

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""I'm not throwing anything.""
links.text: "I'm not throwing anything."

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "There's no way you'd catch that cig..."
links.text: There's no way you'd catch that cigarette anyway.

links.title: You: "What, really?"
links.text: What, really?

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "Yes, really. Don't even try. You'll..."
links.text: Yes, really. Don't even try. You'll just embarrass yourself.

links.title: You: ""You're right, that was obviously a..."
links.text: "You're right, that was obviously a bad idea. Forget I said anything."

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""As you wish." He takes another dra..."
links.text: "As you wish." He takes another drag.

links.title: You: ""Actually, the police *really* need..."
links.text: "Actually, the police *really* needs to talk to you."

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""Is it really that important?" he a..."
links.text: "Is it really that important?" he asks you, adjusting his shirt.

links.title: Half Light: "Like a nervous cat, he keeps steali..."
links.text: Like a nervous cat, he keeps stealing looks at the neighbouring windows.

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""Alright, but make it quick. Once I..."
links.text: "Alright, but make it quick. Once I finish this cigarette I have to run."

links.title: Physical Instrument: "By god, this young man has the body..."
links.text: By god, this young man has the body of a *decathlete*. His lithe form was practically made for vaulting over the high bar!

links.title: You: ""I need to get inside this apartmen..."
links.text: "I need to get inside this apartment building. Can you help me?"

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""Help you? No, sorry, gendarme..."..."
links.text: "Help you? No, sorry, gendarme..." He shakes his charming head. "I have to run."

links.title: You: ""Son, do you train?""
links.text: "Son, do you train?"

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""Occasionally." He takes another dr..."
links.text: "Occasionally." He takes another drag, filling his lungs with nicotine. "Why?"

links.title: You: ""Are you on the track team?""
links.text: "Are you on the track team?"

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""No, I just like to look good." A l..."
links.text: "No, I just like to look good." A light breeze pulls back a flap of shirt.

links.title: You: ""I get it. Nothing wrong with looki..."
links.text: "I get it. Nothing wrong with looking good."

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: "He gives you a honeyed smile, befor..."
links.text: He gives you a honeyed smile, before shaking off the cigarette ash.

links.title: You: ""A shame. Young man like you, with..."
links.text: "A shame. Young man like you, with a body like yours, you'd be a credit to any track team."

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""Trust me, I'm *not* a team player,..."
links.text: "Trust me, I'm *not* a team player," he says with a honeyed smile.

links.title: You: ""Nothing. You should give up smokin..."
links.text: "Nothing. You should give up smoking, son. It's not good for your health."

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""You're right, it's horrible for th..."
links.text: "You're right, it's horrible for the skin. Very ageing." He takes another drag, before shaking off the ash.

links.title: Endurance: "Not that he has to worry about gett..."
links.text: Not that he has to worry about getting old yet -- he's sparkling with youth, a radiant demi-god.

links.title: You: ""Can you tell me your name?""
links.text: "Can you tell me your name?"

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""My name? My name is Martin Martina..."
links.text: "My name? My name is Martin Martinaise."

links.title: Rhetoric: "That's definitely not his real name..."
links.text: That's definitely not his real name.

links.title: You: ""You're not actually called Martin..."
links.text: "You're not actually called Martin Martinaise, are you?"

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""No, of course not. Could you pleas..."
links.text: "No, of course not. Could you please lower your voice?" He scans the courtyard. It's silent like the bottom of a well, every sound captured and reflected back.

links.title: Authority: "Ask him again."
links.text: Ask him again.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Martin Martinaise? Good local name...."
links.text: Martin Martinaise? Good local name. Let's go with that.

links.title: You: ""Listen, I really need your name.""
links.text: "Listen, I really need your name."

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""And I *really* need to finish this..."
links.text: "And I *really* need to finish this cigarette," he replies with a subtle smile.

links.title: Empathy: "But he hasn't left yet."
links.text: But he hasn't left yet.

links.title: You: ""Looks like you've got a good view..."
links.text: "Looks like you've got a good view of the Whirling's backyard. Can you tell me anything about the hanging?"

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""I can *tell* that you finally got..."
links.text: "I can *tell* that you finally got him down. Thank you -- it was quite a disturbing sight, even by Martinaise standards."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What were you doing last Sunday?""
links.text: "What were you doing last Sunday?"

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""Oh..." He waves lazily with his ci..."
links.text: "Oh..." He waves lazily with his cigarette. "You already asked me that, didn't you?"

links.title: Logic: "Wait, is someone else investigating..."
links.text: Wait, is someone else investigating the lynching?

links.title: You: ""Did I?""
links.text: "Did I?"

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""No, not you." He gestures idly. "S..."
links.text: "No, not you." He gestures idly. "Some more *muscular* type."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And when did you speak to this mor..."
links.text: "And when did you speak to this more *muscular* gentleman?" The lieutenant takes out his little blue notebook and writes something down.

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""Last week? I don't know, look..."..."
links.text: "Last week? I don't know, look..." He looks around the courtyard again. Snow blankets the old patio chairs and dead house plants, and all the neighbouring windows are black.

links.title: Conceptualization: "A downy blanket of white to cover u..."
links.text: A downy blanket of white to cover up the miserable poverty of the scene.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You didn't answer the question. Wh..."
links.text: "You didn't answer the question. What were you doing last Sunday?"

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: "He sighs. "I had a friend over.""
links.text: He sighs. "I had a friend over."

links.title: You: ""What kind of friend?""
links.text: "What kind of friend?"

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""It was my Sunday friend.""
links.text: "It was my Sunday friend."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "A *Sunday friend*? How intriguing....."
links.text: A *Sunday friend*? How intriguing...

links.title: Authority: "Makes sense. Friends are nice on Su..."
links.text: Makes sense. Friends are nice on Sunday. You don't have to work, you can just spend time with pals, watching rugby and drinking beer.

links.title: You: ""What's your friend's real name? Di..."
links.text: "What's your friend's real name? Did he see something?"

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: "He doesn't reply, gesturing 'no' wi..."
links.text: He doesn't reply, gesturing 'no' with his cigarette. Under the dull and darkening sky the neighbouring windows stand silent.

links.title: Half Light: "Someone hides behind a curtain: tho..."
links.text: Someone hides behind a curtain: those windows have eyes and those eyes are watching, spying on you three.

links.title: Half Light: "Someone hides behind a curtain: tho..."
links.text: Someone hides behind a curtain: those windows have eyes and those eyes are watching, spying on you two.

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: "He doesn't reply, gesturing 'no' wi..."
links.text: He doesn't reply, gesturing 'no' with his cigarette. Under the grey sky the neighbouring windows are streaked with rain.

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: "He doesn't reply, gesturing 'no' wi..."
links.text: He doesn't reply, gesturing 'no' with his cigarette. Under the grey sky snow continues to pile on the neighbouring window sills.

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: "He doesn't reply, gesturing 'no' wi..."
links.text: He doesn't reply, gesturing 'no' with his cigarette. In the neighbouring windows you can see faint reflections of his silhouette, all from different angles.

links.title: Rhetoric: "He's deflecting. He's young, with a..."
links.text: He's deflecting. He's young, with a sharp memory. He hasn't had time to drown it in booze and chemicals.

links.title: You: ""You still haven't answered my ques..."
links.text: "You still haven't answered my question. What were you doing last Sunday?"

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""Last week? I don't know, look..."..."
links.text: "Last week? I don't know, look..." He looks around the courtyard again. Rain patters on the window sills and dead house plants, too late to do them any good.

links.title: Conceptualization: "It'll take more than rain to bring..."
links.text: It'll take more than rain to bring this place back to life.

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""Last week? I don't know, look..."..."
links.text: "Last week? I don't know, look..." He looks around the courtyard again. Old patio chairs and dead house plants litter the scene.

links.title: Drama: "He's an actor declaiming a soliloqu..."
links.text: He's an actor declaiming a soliloquy. See how you hang on his every word?

links.title: You: ""Was it someone from the police?""
links.text: "Was it someone from the police?"

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""I couldn't tell you," he says, exh..."
links.text: "I couldn't tell you," he says, exhaling a little puff of smoke. "We don't usually see much of the *gendarmerie* around here."

links.title: You: ""When was that?""
links.text: "When was that?"

links.title: You: ""Did you?" (Look at Kim.)"
links.text: "Did you?" (Look at Kim.)

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""No, not you two." He gestures idly..."
links.text: "No, not you two." He gestures idly. "Some more *muscular* type."

links.title: You: ""I'm pretty sure I didn't.""
links.text: "I'm pretty sure I didn't."

links.title: You: ""What did you do last Sunday?""
links.text: "What did you do last Sunday?"

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""I'd even go so far as to say that..."
links.text: "I'd even go so far as to say that the view is a little *too good*, my dear gendarme. Do you have an estimate of when the body will be taken away?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We will remove the body as soon as..."
links.text: "We will remove the body as soon as possible. Now tell us, where were you last Sunday?"

links.title: You: ""I'm working on it.""
links.text: "I'm working on it."

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""Thank you.""
links.text: "Thank you."

links.title: You: ""Alright, we'll talk later." [Leave..."
links.text: "Alright, we'll talk later." [Leave.]

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""No, we won't." He takes one last d..."
links.text: "No, we won't." He takes one last drag of his cigarette, before stubbing it out on the balcony.

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""Now, if you'll excuse me, I really..."
links.text: "Now, if you'll excuse me, I really need to get going."

links.title: Composure: "There's something about the way he..."
links.text: There's something about the way he carries himself... Something enviable, mysterious, attractive...

links.title: You: ""No problem. We'll talk more next t..."
links.text: "No problem. We'll talk more next time." [Leave.]

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""There won't *be* a next time." He..."
links.text: "There won't *be* a next time." He takes a last drag of his cigarette, before stubbing it out in the balcony snow. "I really need to get going."

links.title: You: "Convince him to stay."
links.text: Convince him to stay.

links.title: Suggestion: "This isn't the place or time for qu..."
links.text: This isn't the place or time for questions: Who knows who might be watching from the distance, hidden behind the curtains.

links.title: You: ""Hey, listen..." (Lower your voice...."
links.text: "Hey, listen..." (Lower your voice.) "I am just trying to make things okay again. Can we meet again somewhere else?"

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: "For a moment the man on the balcony..."
links.text: For a moment the man on the balcony seems almost vulnerable. Something moves in the depths of his feline eyes: compassion, and a hint of understanding.

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""I am sorry, but I really don't hav..."
links.text: "I am sorry, but I really don't have the information you're looking for." His voice is soft and deliberate. With a flick of his wrist, he sends the cigarette butt sailing over the rail...

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: "But hold on, what's that? For a spl..."
links.text: But hold on, what's that? For a split second his hand lingers... as though gesturing towards a stone placed right next to the front door...

links.title: Suggestion: "It's a sign!"
links.text: It's a sign!

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""Good luck with the investigation."..."
links.text: "Good luck with the investigation." He walks away.

links.title: Suggestion: "Time to bring out your secret charm..."
links.text: Time to bring out your secret charm: tears and begging! Show him your *emotional* side, throw yourself before his very feet like a dog!

links.title: You: ""What do you want from me? Do you w..."
links.text: "What do you want from me? Do you want me to *cry*?! Huh?"

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""No, for god's sake, I don't want y..."
links.text: "No, for god's sake, I don't want you to cry!" He takes a quick step back and looks around, clearly disturbed.

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""Listen, I really have to go." With..."
links.text: "Listen, I really have to go." With a flick of his wrist he sends the extinguished cigarette sailing over the rail.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Ah, there it goes -- *wasted*! You..."
links.text: Ah, there it goes -- *wasted*! You would have gotten at least a few good drags out of it.

links.title: You: ""Please don't go! I'll stop drinkin..."
links.text: "Please don't go! I'll stop drinking, I'll... take the trash out, just... please don't leave me."

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""*Trash*?" The young man shakes his..."
links.text: "*Trash*?" The young man shakes his head in confusion.

links.title: Empathy: "Please don't go, I'll even stop smo..."
links.text: Please don't go, I'll even stop smoking inside.

links.title: You: "Let him go. [Leave.]"
links.text: Let him go. [Leave.]

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""Good luck with the investigation.""
links.text: "Good luck with the investigation."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He's gone." The lieutenant puts aw..."
links.text: "He's gone." The lieutenant puts away his notebook and turns to you.

links.title: You: ""We should run after him, see where..."
links.text: "We should run after him, see where he went!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No point in running. Tenements lik..."
links.text: "No point in running. Tenements like these often have multiple exits. If he doesn't want to talk to us, then he'll know how to hide himself."

links.title: You: ""So we just give up?""
links.text: "So we just give up?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He could be a witness, him or his..."
links.text: "He could be a witness, him or his *Sunday friend*. Either way we need to look into that *muscular type* who's asking about our case..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He did leave us a sign, did you se..."
links.text: "He did leave us a sign, did you see that? He wanted to draw our attention to that stone right over there." The lieutenant nods towards a small rock on a soggy patch of grass.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""If we find a way inside the buildi..."
links.text: "If we find a way inside the building, we can ask around for his apartment."

links.title: You: ""Great, let's do that." [Leave.]"
links.text: "Great, let's do that." [Leave.]

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There has to be a way of getting i..."
links.text: "There has to be a way of getting inside the building -- let's go check out the door near the pier again. Once we've found the way in, we can ask around for his apartment."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There has to be a way of getting i..."
links.text: "There has to be a way of getting inside the building. Once we've found the way in, we can ask around for his apartment."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He could be a witness. And either..."
links.text: "He could be a witness. And either way we need to look into that *muscular type* who's asking about our case..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He could be a witness, him or his..."
links.text: "He could be a witness, him or his *Sunday friend*. It's worth looking into..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He could be a witness. We shouldn'..."
links.text: "He could be a witness. We shouldn't rule out the possibility..."

links.title: You: ""You're right, he probably didn't h..."
links.text: "You're right, he probably didn't have anything important to say anyway."

links.title: You: ""Too late, young man. Trouble's fou..."
links.text: "Too late, young man. Trouble's found you."

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""Sorry, I don't have time for this...."
links.text: "Sorry, I don't have time for this. I just want to finish my cigarette and be gone."

links.title: You: ""I'll come back to this later." [Le..."
links.text: "I'll come back to this later." [Leave.]
